result.execSummary:
The defendant Dewayne V Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit. To be paid as a condition of probation.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling. 
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed. 
Court recommends to DOJ to revoke the defendant for ANY drug related infraction. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 6 months HUBER with release for work search, work AODA treatment and/or counseling and child care. Defendant is eligible for good time credit. 
LAST 6 months HUBER with same release conditions, STAYED, to be used at agents discretion.
To Report on 01/25/2020 by 09:00am
02/04/2020 COURT GRANTS REQUEST THAT HUBER MAY BE TRANSFERRED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dewayne V Wilson

records.addlTxt: End of representation letter, dated 01/30/2020, filed by Atty. Kegel.

Dated 1/29/2020 from Atty Katie Kegel requesting the defendant's condition time be transferred to Milwaukee County.    ** Reviewed by Judge Lazar on 02/04/2020 - Court approves transfer of condition time to Milwaukee.**
Sentencing Memorandum filed by Atty. Kegel.
Sentencing hearing on January 7, 2020 at 09:30 am.

11:16 AM Defendant Dewayne V Wilson in court with attorney Katie B. Kegel.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that the matter was set for sentencing today.  Atty. Kegel advises the court of the status of the case; she needs some additional time to review the sentencing memorandum with the defendant before proceeding.  Atty. Kegel is requesting a new sentencing date and has no objection to setting the date into January 2020.  State has no objection to the request.  Court adjourns for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2020 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 4, 2019 at 11:00 am.

10:43 AM Attorney Jeremy Perri for attorney Katie B. Kegel in court.   Defendant Dewayne V Wilson did not appear.   Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that the matter was set for sentencing at 10:30.  Atty. Perri advises that he was expecting the defendant to appear and does not know why the defendant has not appeared.  Court notes that the defendant was in court for the plea hearing on August 7th and reviews the case.  Atty. Perri advises that he has not recently spoken with the defendant but is not able to advise whether or not Atty. Kegel has had contact with the defendant.  Atty. Pitzo presents statements and is asking a capias be issued and bail be revoked and/or forfeited.  Atty. Perri is requesting that any forfeiture of the bail be stayed.  Court will issue a capias and revoke the bail; Court will allow time before it foreits the bail until 11/8/19.  Case recalled at 11:01 a.m.; Defendant Dewayne V Wilson in court with attorney Jeremy Perri for attorney Katie B. Kegel.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on the defendant's appearance the Court will no longer be issuing the capias and bail will no longer be revoked or forfeited.  Atty. Perri presents statements and is requesting a new sentencing hearing some time this month.  Atty. Pitzo has no objection to the request.  Court will adjourn for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2019 at 11:00 am.
Appointing attorney Katie Kegel
Appointing Atty. Kegel as counsel of record for the defendant.
End of representation letter, dated 8/30/19, filed by Atty. Benedict.
Sentencing hearing on October 7, 2019 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:49 AM Defendant Dewayne V Wilson in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Brook Erickson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Benedict presents the offer.  State confirms the offer as placed on the record.  Atty. Benedict is asking that sentencing be set out to October.  State has no objection.  Court will proceed with the plea only today and adjourn for sentencing.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 5.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders Counts 1-4 & 6-8 dismissed and read in.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2019 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on August 7, 2019 at 09:30 am.

09:54 AM Defendant Dewayne V Wilson in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for hearing on Defendant's Miranda Goodchild motion.  Atty. Benedict advises the court of the status of negotiations with the State and as a result the hearing does not need to proceed today.  Atty. Opper presents statements and is asking the court to accept defense's withdraw of their motion and notes that their witness is present and was prepared to proceed with testimony today.  Atty. Benedict is moving to withdraw the Miranda Goodchild motion.  Court will accept the withdrawal of defense's Miranda Goodchild motion.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings/status in early August.  Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2019 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statements filed by Atty. Benedict.
Motion hearing on July 12, 2019 at 09:30 am.

10:54 AM Defendant Dewayne V Wilson in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Benedict advises the court of the status of the case and is requesting the matter be set for a Miranda Goodchild hearing; he should be able to file the motion by the end of the week.  Atty. Benedict presents additional statements and is requesting the matter go right to an evidentiary hearing.  Court will order Atty. Benedict file his Miranda Goodchild motion by 05/10/2019; State to file their response brief, if any, by 06/14/2019.  Court will adjourn for formal hearing on Defendant's Miranda Goodchild Motion.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 12, 2019 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on May 1, 2019 at 09:30 am.

09:31 AM Defendant Dewayne V Wilson in court with attorney Paul Crawford for attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Crawford advises the court of the status of the case and is requesting another further proceedings date in about 3 weeks.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2019 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on April 15, 2019 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on February 27, 2019 at 10:00 am.

10:25 AM Defendant Dewayne V Wilson in court with attorney Amber Rumpf for attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Rumpf advises the court of the status of the case and is requesting another further proceedings date at the end of February.  No objection from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for February 27, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on January 14, 2019 at 09:30 am.

An attorney will be appointed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 1, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 17, 2018 at 10:00 am.
